1) "Elysium" (2013)
This dystopian science fiction film directed by Neill Blomkamp, features a cast including Sharlto Copley and Matt Damon. The film takes place in the year 2154 when the very wealthy live on a man-made space station while the rest of the population resides on a ruined Earth.

In "Elysium," an idyllic, small, self- sufficient community lives on a space station. Everything you could possibly need is within walking distance. But in this peaceful community, there are also dark secrets and hidden traumas that have been haunting the residents of this once idyllic community now living on a man-made space station.

Another notable aspect of "Elysium" is its exploration of themes such as poverty, social inequality, environmental degradation, nuclear war, terrorism, personal responsibility, moral relativism, and faith in humanity.

2) "Brokeback Mountain" (1995)
This critically acclaimed drama film directed by David Lynch, features a cast including Jack Nance, James Spader, and Robert Forster.

Based on your preferences and interest in war movies, I would recommend watching "Inglourious Basterds" (2009) directed by Quentin Tarantino. The movie is a fictional account of the real-life events that took place during World War II in Nazi-occupied France and Germany. 

The main characters are a group of Jewish American soldiers who are part of the United States Army Signal Corps 13th Field Artillery Battalion during World War II.
